workflow.name: ‚úàÔ∏è CO2 emissions of business travels with Carbon Interface API and GPT-4o
workflow.description:
***Tags**: Sustainability, Business Travel, Carbon Emissions, Flight Tracking, Carbon Interface API*

### Context

Hi! I‚Äôm [Samir](https://samirsaci.com), a Supply Chain Engineer and Data Scientist based in Paris, and founder of [LogiGreen Consulting](https://logi-green.com).

I help companies monitor and reduce their environmental footprint by combining **AI automation**, **carbon estimation APIs**, and **workflow automation**.

This workflow is part of our **sustainability reporting initiative**, allowing businesses to **track the CO‚ÇÇ emissions of employee flights**.

> Automate carbon tracking for your business travel with AI-powered workflows in n8n!

üì¨ For business inquiries, feel free to connect with me on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/samir-saci)

### Who is this template for?

This workflow is designed for **travel managers**, **sustainability teams**, or **finance teams** who need to measure and report on emissions from business travel.

Let‚Äôs imagine your company receives a **flight confirmation email**:

[![Example Email](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/2025/06/image-17.png)](https://bit.ly/playlist-n8n-supplyscience)

The **AI Agent** reads the email and extracts structured data, such as **flight dates, airport codes, and number of passengers**.

Then, the **Carbon Interface API** is called to estimate **CO‚ÇÇ emissions**, which are stored in a **Google Sheet** for sustainability reporting.

[![Workflow](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/2025/06/image-18.png)](https://bit.ly/playlist-n8n-supplyscience)

### How does it work?

This workflow automates the end-to-end process of **tracking flight emissions** from email to CO‚ÇÇ estimation:

- üì® Gmail Trigger captures booking confirmations  
- üß† AI Agent extracts structured data (airports, dates, flight numbers)  
- ‚úàÔ∏è Each flight leg is processed individually  
- üåç Carbon Interface API returns distance and carbon emissions  
- üìÑ A second Google Sheet node appends the emission data for reporting

### Steps:

1. üíå Trigger on new flight confirmation email  
2. üß† Extract structured trip data using AI Agent (flights, airports, dates)  
3. üìë Store flight metadata in Google Sheets  
4. üß≠ For each leg, call the Carbon Interface API  
5. üì• Append distance, CO‚ÇÇ in kg, and timestamp to the flight row  

[![workflow](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/size/w1600/2025/06/image-19.png)](https://bit.ly/playlist-n8n-supplyscience)

### What do I need to get started?

You‚Äôll need:

- A **Gmail account** receiving SAP Concur or travel confirmation emails  
- A **Google Sheet** to record trip metadata and CO‚ÇÇ emissions  
- A free [Carbon Interface API key](https://www.carboninterface.com/docs)  
- Access to OpenAI for parsing the email via AI Agent  
- A few sample flight confirmation emails to test

### üì∫ Learn More with n8n Tutorials 

Get hands-on experience with automation through my comprehensive **n8n tutorial playlist**, featuring 18+ complete, step-by-step videos and ready-to-use templates.

[![n8n Playlist](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/size/w1600/2025/11/image-9.png)](https://bit.ly/playlist-n8n-supplyscience)

### Next Steps

üóíÔ∏è Use the sticky notes in the n8n canvas to:

- Add your Gmail and Carbon Interface credentials  
- Send a sample booking email to your inbox  
- Verify that emissions and distances are correctly added to your sheet  

*This template was built using n8n v1.93.0*  
*Submitted: June 7, 2025*

workflow.name: ‚úàÔ∏è CO2 Emissions of Business Travels with CarbonInterface API and GPT-4o

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "traveler_name": "Samir Saci",
  "trip_purpose": "Sustainability Client Workshop",
  "trip_id": "LG-TRIP-2025-0624",
  "flights": [
    {
      "type": "departure",
      "from": "Paris Charles de Gaulle (CDG)",
      "to": "Toronto Pearson International (YYZ)",
      "from_code": "CDG",
      "to_code": "YYZ",
      "date": "2025-06-24",
      "flight_number": "AF356"
    },
    {
      "type": "return",
      "from": "Toronto Pearson International (YYZ)",
      "to": "Paris Charles de Gaulle (CDG)",
      "from_code": "YYZ",
      "to_code": "CDG",

      "flight_number": "AC880"
    }
  ],
  "hotel_booked": false,
  "ground_transport_booked": false
}

parameters.text:
=Extract the structured trip details from the following email:

{{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a travel assistant. When provided with the body of a business trip confirmation email, extract the following structured JSON object.

Return **only** a JSON object with the following fields:

{
  "traveler_name": string,
  "trip_purpose": string,
  "trip_id": string,
  "flights": [
    {
      "type": "departure" or "return",
      "from": string,
      "from_code": string (e.g., "CDG"),
      "to": string,
      "to_code": string (e.g., "YYZ"),
      "date": string (ISO 8601, e.g., "2025-06-24"),
      "flight_number": string
    }
  ],
  "hotel_booked": boolean,
  "ground_transport_booked": boolean
}

- Extract the 3-letter airport codes (IATA format) from the airport names and populate `from_code` and `to_code`.
- If hotel or ground transport is marked ‚ÄúNot booked,‚Äù return `false`, otherwise `true`.
- Always include both departure and return flights as separate items in the "flights" array.
- Return only the JSON object, no extra text.

parameters.content:
### 1. Workflow Trigger with Gmail Trigger
The workflow is triggered by a new email received in your Gmail mailbox dedicated to process **flight schedules**.

#### How to setup?
- **Gmail Trigger Node:** set up your Gmail API credentials
[Learn more about the Gmail Trigger Node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/trigger-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.gmailtrigger)

### 2. AI Agent to trip schedule report
This node will analyze the content of the email to extract information about the trip including **departure** and **return** trips with **airport codes** and booking information. 

#### How to setup?
- **AI Agent with the Chat Model**:
   1. Add a **chat model** with the required credentials *(Example: Open AI 4o-mini)*
   2. Adapt the system prompt to the format of emails you expect to receive *(type of information included)*
  [Learn more about the AI Agent Node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/root-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent)

### 3. Record Shipment Request Information and fetch distance and driving time using Open Route API
This starts by recording all the information parsed by the AI node. Then, we use the **Open Route API** to complete with **geocoding data** *(GPS Coordinates)* that will be used to fetch **driving distance and time**.

#### How to setup?
- **Setup Carbone Interface API Credentials**
  1. Get your free API key: [Carbon Interface API Documentation](https://docs.carboninterface.com/#/)
  2. Fill the API key in the HTTP request node
- **Load records in the Google Sheet Node**:
   1. Add your Google Sheet API credentials to access the Google Sheet file
   2. Select the file using the list, an URL or an ID
   3. Select the sheet in which you want to record your working sessions
   4. Map the fields: **traveler_name**, **trip_purpose**, **trip_id**, **hotel_booked**, **ground_transport_booked**, **flight_type**, **from**, **from_code**, **to**, **to_code**, **flight_date**, **flight_number**, **distance_km**, **carbon_kg**, **estimated_at**
													
  [Learn more about the Google Sheet Node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.googlesheets)

Distance, carbon emissions and estimation time will be fetched from the **Carbone Interface API**.
